About Me

BIO

I am a Computer Science student at City University London, avid Hackathon goer and passionate self learner. Outside of university I spend my time working on side coding projects, working out, volunteering and looking for the best coffe shops.

USource Technology

Front-end intern

My role required me to pick up various technologies quickly and improve problem solving techniques. One of the things I improved the most on is creating responsive websites that look the same across all browsers. I also contributed to the team by improving performance through removing unnecesary dependencies using NPM scripts instead of Gulp JS.

Fortech

Android Intern

This position has challenged my technical skills, namely JAVA for Android and knowledge of working with API's but also soft skills. I built an app for Tourists helping them find Landmarks and suggestions in my home town with the help of google maps API. At the end of the summer I had to give a presentation on it and a demo. in front of the Android team.

Quantic Labs

Quality Assurance

This position was my first introduction in the IT world. I was always busy with breaking games and thinking outside the box to find bugs. This involved a lot of going back and forth with the Developer in order to fix these issues.
